value_claims.claim_title: First bank in Malaysia to offer fully digital account onboarding via eKYC
value_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Bank became the first bank in Malaysia to offer a truly digital onboarding experience, eliminating the need for physical branch visits through eKYC technology.
value_claims.source_quote: Hong Leong Bank and Hong Leong Islamic Bank have announced a historic milestone by becoming the first bank in Malaysia to offer a truly digital onboarding experience for Malaysians looking to open a bank account
value_claims.attribution_evidence: eKYC involves identity verification technology but no explicit mention of AI/ML models like Gemini in the source material

value_claims.claim_title: 300% increase in processed vehicle loans through digital platform
value_claims.claim_description: A customized digital platform for vehicle loans achieved a 300% increase in processed loans, rising from S$99 million in 2023 to S$400 million in 2024.
value_claims.source_quote: a customised digital platform for vehicle loans achieved a 300% increase in processed loans, rising from S$99 million in 2023 to S$400 million in 2024
value_claims.attribution_evidence: Digital platform enabled the increase, but specific AI attribution unclear. Partnership with WeBank Technology Services for AI mentioned separately.

value_claims.claim_title: End-to-end digital account opening process through Apply@HLB mobile app
value_claims.claim_description: Customers can open bank accounts in three simple steps via mobile app: verify identity with national ID and selfie, fill personal details, and create login credentials.
value_claims.source_quote: With the 'Apply@HLB' mobile app, customers can open a bank account in three simple steps - verify identity with the national identity card and a selfie, fill in personal details and lastly, create a username and password
value_claims.attribution_evidence: Identity verification via selfie likely uses computer vision/AI, though not explicitly stated. eKYC technology typically involves AI-powered facial recognition.

value_claims.claim_title: Partnership with WeBank Technology Services to enhance AI automation
value_claims.claim_description: HLF partnered with WeBank Technology Services to leverage AI expertise for enhancing automation and customer experience in digital banking operations.
value_claims.source_quote: HLF's recent partnership with WeBank Technology Services—a subsidiary of China's WeBank—exemplifies this alignment. By leveraging WeBank's AI expertise, HLF aims to enhance automation and customer experience
value_claims.attribution_evidence: Explicitly mentions leveraging AI expertise from WeBank to enhance automation and customer experience

value_claims.claim_title: Accelerated digital roadmap delivery during COVID-19
value_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Bank accelerated delivery of its digital roadmap to ensure customers could access products and services on mobile during the COVID-19 pandemic.
value_claims.source_quote: since the Covid-19 outbreak started, the Bank has accelerated the delivery of its digital roadmap to ensure customers are able to access the products and services on mobile
value_claims.quote_location: Quote from Chief Digital and Innovation Officer
value_claims.attribution_evidence: Digital transformation mentioned but no specific AI attribution. Part of broader digital strategy context.

context_claims.claim_title: Digital account onboarding launched following BNM eKYC guideline in June 2020
context_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Bank's digital onboarding capability was enabled by Bank Negara Malaysia's eKYC guideline published in June 2020
context_claims.source_quote: Following the publication of Bank Negara Malaysia's guideline on Electronic Know-Your-Customer (eKYC) in June 2020

context_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Bank operates in the Malaysian banking and financial services sector
context_claims.source_quote: Hong Leong Bank and Hong Leong Islamic Bank

context_claims.claim_description: Digital transformation focused on customer account opening and onboarding processes
context_claims.source_quote: customers can open a bank account in three simple steps

context_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Bank's strategic approach centers on digital transformation as a core organizational strategy
Hong Leong Bank has operations in Malaysia, Vietnam, Cambodia, and Singapore
context_claims.source_quote: Participating teams will also get a chance to be mentored by top executives from HLB's regional counterparts in Vietnam, Cambodia and Singapore

context_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Bank is pursuing Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) focused solutions through technology and innovation initiatives
context_claims.source_quote: This virtual hackathon themed 'Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) aims to get creative ideas and solutions on how people in the region interpret ESG

context_claims.claim_description: The COVID-19 pandemic created urgency and opportunity for accelerated digital banking adoption
context_claims.source_quote: This simple and convenient way of banking is timely given the ongoing Covid-19 health concerns and corresponding shift to digital 'everything'

context_claims.claim_title: Digital banking products including accounts, credit cards, and loans
context_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Bank offers digital account opening, credit card applications, and personal loan applications through mobile channels
context_claims.source_quote: In addition to account opening, we will soon activate a fully digital credit card and personal loan application process

context_claims.claim_description: Digital identity verification using eKYC technology for customer onboarding
context_claims.source_quote: verify identity with the national identity card and a selfie

context_claims.claim_title: Vehicle loan portfolio growth from S$99M to S$400M
context_claims.claim_description: Hong Leong Finance's vehicle loan business scaled from S$99 million in 2023 to S$400 million in 2024
context_claims.source_quote: rising from S$99 million in 2023 to S$400 million in 2024
